newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine minister sees no need for labour decree.
newsitem.headline: Argentine minister sees no need for labour decree.

text.p: Argentine Labor Minister Armando Caro Figueroa was quoted as saying on Wednesday he felt the government will not need to impose labour reforms by decree thanks to progress in talks among legislators debating a bill.
The government of Peronist President Carlos Menem has threatened to pass a decree by the end of the year if Congress does not support the plan to loosen labour laws.

"I don't think it will be necessary because it is well on its way via the parliamentary course and there is no doubt that it is better for the country to have a law," the local DyN news agency quoted Figueroa as saying.
The bill would eliminate collective bargaining and set more flexible hours and conditions for Argentine workers.
It has faced strong opposition from members of the opposition and even from within the ruling party.
